alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 9:09PM PST until February 25 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Ventura River At Foster Park affecting Ventura County. For the Ventura River...including Foster Park...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ventura River At Foster Park. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.6 feet, the Ventura River begins to flood the Ventura Beach RV Resort and agricultural areas upstream of the Main Street Bridge in ventura. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:40 PM PST Friday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 18.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 11.1 feet early Monday afternoon. It will rise to 13.0 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.6 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 01/05/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Ventura River Foster Park 17.6 17.3 Fri 8 pm PST 14.1 11.4 12.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 800 AM PST.
